pages.text: For a multitude of reasons, many Elder Gods do not choose to manifest on Earth. However, they are very aware they have worshipers, and even though they are largely indifferent to worshipers and non-worshipers in most cases, they will often send $(marked)emissaries$() to act in place of them as figureheads of worship, to act as guardians for cults.

They also help to initiate worshipers into higher states beyond that of which a human cultist can assist with.$(br)Emissaries can be anything from powerful offspring to lesser avatars of Elder Gods, and they possess great powers, more so than even an ascended cultist, but even at that they are still mortal; however attempting to slay one is foolish.

Emissaries often live in the realm of their master, but certain $(ml:rites/rite_intro)rites$() can allow them passage to this realm.$(br2)$(o)Most worshipers falsely assume the emissaries are the actual Elder God, which is why most effigies of Elder Gods actually depict their emissaries.$()
